required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Once a Day Immunosuppression Regimen: Outcomes and Compliance

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to determine whether an immunosuppressive maintenance regimen of Envarsus/azathioprine compared to a tacrolimus/ mycophenolic acid regimen is associated with better compliance, tolerability, and lower biopsy proven rejection.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Compliance and tolerability of medication regimen at 3 and 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Self-recorded Compliance and tolerability of medication regimen at 3 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Pill Manager (personal medication record keeping for those who participants who choose to use this method of recording their self-administered medication)
Incidence of Biopsy proven Acute Rejection, graft loss, death, Lost to follow-up at 12 months.

arm_group.description: Once daily medication regimen (Envarsus and azathioprine)
Twice daily medication regimen (Tacrolimus and mycophenolic acid)

intervention.description: Intervention focuses on the type of regimen, in this case the intervention arm will receive a once daily regimen for immunosuppression compared to the twice daily regimen.
This is the arm which we are designating the standard, which will be the comparison to the active drug arm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >/= 18 years old
- Kidney transplant recipient
- Thymoglobulin induction
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-renal organ transplant
- Combined organ transplant
- Inability to receive Envarsus after transplant
- Discharged to acute care facility after transplant

reference.citation: Budde K, Bunnapradist S, Grinyo JM, Ciechanowski K, Denny JE, Silva HT, Rostaing L; Envarsus study group. Epub 2012 Dec 21.
